Landing.title: Free Password Generator — Create Strong, Secure Passwords Instantly
Landing.subtitle: One click to a strong, random password—free, private, and fast
Landing.usp_1_text: Keep your passwords private—even from us. Local-only encryption protects your vault with end-to-end privacy.
Landing.usp_2_text: Get warned if your email or credentials appear online so you can act fast and prevent identity theft.
Landing.usp_3_text: Find weak or reused passwords and replace them with unique, strong ones using the built-in generator.
Landing.usp_4_text: Add MFA—one-time codes, biometrics, or apps—to block attackers and boost account security.

Faqs.title: Frequently asked questions
Faqs.faq1_q: How does the password generator work?
Faqs.faq1_a_p1: The generator creates random passwords based on your choices: length, ease of reading, and whether to include uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols.
Faqs.faq1_a_p2: Each result is checked with the widely used zxcvbn library to estimate strength.
Faqs.faq1_aText: The generator creates random passwords from your chosen options. Each result is checked with the zxcvbn library to estimate strength.
Faqs.faq2_q: How do I create a strong password?
Faqs.faq2_a_p1: Keep it unique and long. Aim for 15+ characters with a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols. Avoid common words and personal info.
Faqs.faq2_a_p2: The built-in generator makes a fresh, complex password every time—great for new accounts or replacing weak ones.
Faqs.faq2_aText: Use 15+ characters with letters, numbers, and symbols. Avoid common words and personal info. The generator creates strong, unique passwords.
Faqs.faq3_q: Can a strong password be hacked?
Faqs.faq3_a_p1: In theory yes, but a strong 12+ character password can take an extremely long time to crack with current methods. Some estimates show crack times in the thousands of years.
Faqs.faq3_aText: In theory yes, but a strong 12+ character password can take an extremely long time to crack with current methods.

Faqs.faq4_a_p1_after: so only you can read them.
Faqs.faq4_aText: Yes. Passwords are generated locally and can be stored encrypted in your vault so only you can read them.
Faqs.faq5_q: Is the password stored in your system?
Faqs.faq5_a_p1: No. This tool runs fully in your browser. We don’t send or store your password on any server.
Faqs.faq5_a_p2: Generation and strength checks happen on your device. Copy and save it where you prefer, and clear your clipboard on shared machines.
Faqs.faq5_aText: No. Everything runs in your browser; nothing is sent or stored on our servers. Clear your clipboard on shared devices.
